intro: Macoucoua, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, blue, and white, making it a popular ornamental plant. Macoucoua thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
